The Toys

All these toys already.

I really don’t know where all these come from. Truly. They seem to accumulate overnight..you would think they were rabbits living under our shed (which is a whole other story)

Today was kind of a big day. She managed to pull herself up to the toybox all by herself and starting to pull stuff out. As this was the first time that this happend I let it slide. I mean, this is the equivalent of pulling your weight up until you can get your legs under you - that’s a lot of work and something that I am sure I could not do.

So, toys.

We have talking elephants, multiples of stuffed bears, toys with suction cups, 2 tablets, one laptop and one toy is one where it’s a pair and they talk to each other. OMG do I want a mute button on that thing.

Despite having all these toys that don’t even fill our toybox to maximum capacity she’s most iterested in the stuff she can’t or shouldn’t have like phone charging cords or other dangerous stuff in the house. We’ve baby-proofed with the outlet plugs and door stops so we’re good but if you want to be sure if your home is baby-proofed the only way to find out is to let a baby loose and they will let you know in under a minute.

One nice thing about having a bunch of toys is that there was a lot that were forgotten about so it’s like Christmas all over. There’s also the fact that I prune the toybox from time to time and donate the toys we don’t need as she’s grown out of them or we just have too many.

All of the toys you see - and more - will be gone and forgotten over the years and replaced by an iPhone before I would like so for just today I’m celebrating her toy collection.

April 25, 2020 ·
